data.name: See.Also
data.value: See also

data.name: No.Help.Header
data.value: We are sorry

data.name: No.Help.Line1
data.value: We are sorry, The document you are requests has not been found.

data.name: Overview.Help.Topic
data.value: Overview

data.name: Overview.Help.Topic.Quick.Summary
data.value: An overall view about RomanApp.

data.name: Overview.Header
data.value: Help

data.name: Overview.Summary
data.value:
This help will guide you through the app, trying to clear any doubts you may have about its purpose, usage and development.

You can access the Help at any moment by tapping the three dot menu at the top right corner of the screen and then tapping "Help". This will open the Help view at the section you are currently working on.

For example if you access the Help while you were in the Settings panel you will access the Settings section of the Help.

But don't worry. You can access any section or topic you need by tapping the index button at the top right corner.

One more thing that might be useful to know is the "See also" portion. You may spot it at the bottom of the view. This will list related topics to which you are currently reading about.

data.name: Overview.About.What.Header
data.value: What is RomanApp?

data.name: Overview.About.What
data.value:
RomanApp is a tool to divide the expenses between all the guests in a current event.

In a scenario where some guests have contributed money for the event and some didn't, RomanApp will display the amounts of money that every guests, the ones who did not contributed enough, owe and the amount every guest should collect, the ones that contributed more than they have to.

data.name: Overview.About.Work.Header
data.value: How does it work?

data.name: Overview.About.Work
data.value:
This app works completely offline. There is no need to have any Internet or LAN connection available to run it. It can run on Airplane Mode if needed.

It will also store your progress locally so you can revisit your work at any time even after restarting your device.

data.name: Overview.About.Encrypted.Header
data.value: Is the stored data encrypted?

data.name: Overview.About.Encrypted
data.value: No.

data.name: Sheet.Overview.Help.Topic
data.value: Main panel

data.name: Sheet.Overview.Help.Topic.Quick.Summary
data.value: A first glace of the main panel.

data.name: Sheet.Overview.Summary.Part1
data.value:
The Main panel is where you will spend most of the time using the app.
Here you will be able to input the event's information and see the result in real time.

The event's information consists of two type of elements:

  • Guests
  • Expenses

The guests are the people attending the event. Each one is identified by their name, which can be repeated among other guests and may carry a contribution for the event.

The expenses are products or services that will be consumed during the event and will need to be paid for when this finishes. They are also identified by name, which can also be repeated among other expenses and must have a value greater than zero.

data.name: Sheet.Overview.Summary.Part2
data.value: At any time during the event you may add, edit and remove any element (guests and/or expenses) which will be composing the total cost of the event. At the same time the app will calculate how much money should some guests pay to cover the cost of the event and how much money should other guests collect from that to cover their difference of the share.

data.name: Sheet.Overview.Summary.Note.Input
data.value: For more information on how to work with this portion of the panel check the Input Tab link in the "See Also" section below.

data.name: Sheet.Overview.Summary.Note.Outcome
data.value: For more information on how to read the outcome calculation check the Outcome Tab link in the "See Also" section below.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Help.Topic
data.value: Input tab

data.name: Sheet.Input.Help.Topic.Quick.Summary
data.value: Detailed explanation of the input tab, its components and its usage.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Summary
data.value:
This tab allows you to enter the event information regarding guests and expenses.

All data you enter will automatically be stored in your device for you to resume your work at any time, even after the app is terminated or the device is restarted.

You can delete the complete stored data (input and app data) and start from scratch (as if RomanApp has been reinstalled) by going to the Application Manager in your device settings and clearing the Data. Check your device manual for more details.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Components.Header
data.value: What does this tab contain?

data.name: Sheet.Input.Components
data.value:
The Input tab is composed by two main groups:

  • Guests
  • Expenses

You can see them as boxes vertically positioned in the content of the tab.

Each box, or group, has a header that describes what elements they represents ("Guests" or "Expenses") followed by the number of elements added.

On the top right corner of each box there is a circular button with a "plus" icon in it. This will allow you to enter a new element into the group.

By default both groups have no elements in them, in which case a message will be displayed at the center of the box describing the case.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Adding.Header
data.value: How can I add an element for my event?

data.name: Sheet.Input.Adding.Part1
data.value:
You can add as many elements as you want, either guests or expenses by tapping the "plus" button at the top right corner of the corresponding box.

This will popup a window that will, at its top, display the proper action that is taking place.

  • "Add a guest" if you tapped the button of the first box.
  • "Add an expense" if you tapped the button of the second box.

Followed by the header, in the center of the window, is the element's information form. For either a Guest or Expense you can enter the name (first field) and the amount (second field).

data.name: Sheet.Input.Adding.Note.Amount.Label
data.value:
Notice that the second field will display a different label depending of the type of element that you are adding:
  • "Contribution" if you are adding a Guest.
  • "Value" if you are adding an Expense.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Adding.Part2
data.value:
In any case the Name field is required and the Contribution or Value can't have a negative number.

If you are adding an Expense the value must be greater than 0.

Don't worry about remembering these rules. If you misfollow any of them a message will appear on top of the field guiding you to correct them.

Once the fields are properly set you may tap in the green circular button with a "check" icon in it at the bottom of the window. Doing so the window will close and the item will appear in the corresponding box at the bottom of the list.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Items.List.Header
data.value: Reading the boxes or groups

data.name: Sheet.Input.Items.List
data.value:
Whenever a box contains elements in it the empty message (read above) will be replaced by a list and a footer.

The list, in the center of the box, contains two columns. At the left the name of the element and at the right its contribution or value.

The footer, at the bottom of the box, will show the sum of the contributions or values of the elements.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Edit.Header
data.value: How can I edit the information?

data.name: Sheet.Input.Edit.Part1
data.value:
At any time you may modify the event's information whether by editing an element or removing it.

For any case you can tap the item in the list and the same window used to add it will popup. This time the header of the window will display the name of the element and the fields will already be filled with the selected element's properties.

In case you're attempting to change the information you may tap the "check" button to save it just as you did when you previously add it.

In case you're attempting remove the element from the group you may tap the red circular button with "trash" icon in it at the bottom left of the window. This button will only show up when you're editing an element.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Edit.Delete.Note
data.value: Remember that no confirmation will be required when tapping the "trash" icon and this action cannot be undone.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Edit.Part2
data.value:
Once completed the window will close and you may see the changes in the groups.

If you decide not to perform any changes (adding, editing or deleting) after the window popped you can tap the white circular button with an "X" icon in it, at the bottom center of the window to close it.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Guest.Expense.Header
data.value: Contribution or expense?

data.name: Sheet.Input.Guest.Expense.Part1
data.value: A common question would be when to add an expense or a guest's contribution. For that, first we need to know the definitions of each element.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Guest.Expense.Definition.Guest.Label
data.value: Guest's contribution:

data.name: Sheet.Input.Guest.Expense.Definition.Guest.Description
data.value:
Represents any amount of money that a particular guest spent for this event and has been agreed upon to divide between the rest of the guests.

This could be food a guest brought for everyone, it could be beverages or even a Karaoke machine the guest rented for the night and has already payed for.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Guest.Expense.Definition.Expense.Label
data.value: Expense:

data.name: Sheet.Input.Guest.Expense.Definition.Expense.Description
data.value:
Represents any cost for the event that has not been payed for yet and has been agreed upon to divide between the rest of the guests.

This could be the rent of a grill for a barbacue, a laser tag arena, a whole villa for the night, etc.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Guest.Expense.Part2
data.value: The main difference for calculating the outcome is that unlike a contribution, a new expense will increase the share, while a new contribution (a new guest) may result, depending on their contribution, in a decreasing of the share since is now divided between more guests.

data.name: Sheet.Input.Reset.Header
data.value: Can I clear everything in one go?

data.name: Sheet.Input.Reset
data.value:
Yes. Whenever either boxes contain elements in them the button with an "eraser" icon in it at the top right of the screen, next to the menu button, can be tapped to delete all the information.

A dialog will appear asking you to confirm the operation since this action cannot be undone.

This option will remain disabled whilst both boxes are empty.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Help.Topic
data.value: Outcome tab

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Help.Topic.Quick.Summary
data.value: Detailed explanation of how to read the outcome of an event calculation.

data.name: Sheet.Output.Summary
data.value: This tab will give you the result calculation of every guest's contribution and expense.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Totals.Header
data.value: Summary

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Totals
data.value: At the top of the tab there is a box that shows a quick summary of the calculations:

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Totals.Total.Contributions.Label
data.value: • Total contributions:

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Totals.Total.Contributions.Description
data.value: The sum of all guests' contributions, those which are greater than zero.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Totals.Total.Expenses.Label
data.value: • Total expenses:

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Summary.Total.Expenses.Description
data.value: The sum of all expenses.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Summary.Total.Description
data.value: The sum of all guest's contributions and expenses. This number represents the entire cost of the event.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Summary.Share.Description
data.value: This is the coefficient between the total amount and the number of guests. The share is what each guest is supposed to pay.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Groups.Header
data.value: What's in the box?

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Groups
data.value:
Along with the Summary the outcome provides three different boxes which represent the event's guests sorted in three groups:

  • Those who owe.
  • Those who must collect
  • Those who broke even

Each box has a header that describes, at its left side, what group of guests (described above) contains and the count of guests at its right side.

Inside the box you can see the list of guests. On the left side the guest's name and on the right side the amount that the guest either owes or must collect, depending on which box you're looking at.

The third box, the group of guests that broke even, only shows the names not the amounts since it's understood that said amount is zero.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Groups.Note.Visible
data.value: You may notice that not all the groups are always shown. This is because the outcome only shows those which contain at least one guest after doing the calculations. For example if the outcome states that no guests should collect an amount but all of them should pay at least a part of their share, the second group ("Who must collect?") will not be shown.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Empty.Header
data.value: What is that exclamation mark?

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Empty
data.value: In order to have a proper outcome we need to meet the minimum requirements to get it. If one of them are not met we will see a message informing us why we are not getting a detailed result:

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Empty.No.Total.Label
data.value: • Total contributed must be greater than 0:

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Empty.No.Total.Description
data.value: The total cost of the event (see "Total" in the Summary section above) added up to zero.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Empty.Enough.Guests.Label
data.value: • Not enough guests:

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Empty.Enough.Guests.Description
data.value: You need at least two guests to have the total of the event cost divided in shares.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Empty.No.Debt.Label
data.value: • Nobody owes anything:

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Empty.No.Debt.Description
data.value: After doing the calculations the outcome states that nobody should pay more than they already contributed.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Text.Header
data.value: Explain it to me like I'm 5.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Text
data.value:
Another way to read the result is by tapping the button with the "conversation" icon in it at the bottom of the tab.
This will popup a window explaining step by step the calculation result and what to do with the money.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Header
data.value: Let's take a look at some examples

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples
data.value: To fully understand how to read the outcome result we are going to run some examples. This can be verified entering the same values in the Input tab.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Result
data.value: What's the result?

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Example1.Header
data.value: Example 1 (simple):

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Example1.Premise
data.value:
There are three people attending this event. Myself, John and Mike.

I contributed with nothing whilst John contributed 64 for food and Mike 86 for beverages.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Example1.Result
data.value:
The total spent for this event was 150 (John's food for 64 and Mike's beverages for 86). Divided by the 3 of us gives us a share of 50. That is what each guest is supposed to pay at the end of this event.

But... John and Mike already contributed even more money than their share.

This means that in the outcome I will see myself owing money and John and Mike collecting.

From my full share of 50 we can take 14 for John and 36 for Mike.

Since John contributed 64, by collecting 14 he's leaving his share of 50. And mike, having him pay 86 and collecting 36 he is leaving his share of 50 as well.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Example2.Header
data.value: Example 2 (medium):

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Example2.Premise
data.value:
This time will be using expenses.

Four people at this event: Myself, Chris, Susan and Lucy.

Contributions (4):
• Myself: 105
• Chris: 0
• Susan: 15
• Lucy: 110

We are now adding an expense for 170, let's say for the paintball gear, reloads and time will be using it. We decide to split this evenly.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Example2.Result
data.value:
The total cost of this event is 400. That is 100 for each to pay (the Share).

230 will be for those who contributed (minus their share) and 170 to pay for "paintball".

Chris owes the total share of 100, Susan owes 85 since she already contributed with 15.

Lucy and I will be collecting from what Chris and Susan put on the table. That is a total of 185.

From that I will take 5 and Lucy will take 10 leaving, still, 170 on the table. That is the money that should go to pay for a lovely afternoon of paintball.

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Example3.Header
data.value: Example 3 (advanced):

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Example3.Premise
data.value:
In this example will try to get the use of all three groups of the outcome.

Four people at this event: Myself, Ellen, Leo and Jo.

Contributions (4):
• Myself: 5 (snacks)
• Ellen: 30 (beverages)
• Leo: 25 (more snacks)
• Jo: 0

Expenses (2):
• Tennis court: 35
• DVD recording of the match: 5

data.name: Sheet.Outcome.Examples.Example3.Result
data.value:
The total cost of this event is 100. That is 25 for each to pay (the Share).

Jo and I are the ones who should put money on the table. I should pay 20 since 5 were already covered for snacks and Jo should pay her full share.

A total of 45 is now on the table. 5 goes to Ellen since she contributed with 30.

We are now left with 40 on the table. 35 will go to pay for the Tennis Court and 5 for the DVD recording.

Leo should not pay or receive anything since his contribution matches the share of 25.

data.name: Sheet.Settings.Help.Topic
data.value: Settings

data.name: Sheet.Settings.Help.Topic.Quick.Summary
data.value: Definition of each configuration property. Their purpose and their impact in the app.

data.name: Sheet.Settings
data.value: This panel will allow you to configure different aspects and behaviours of the app. All changes will be immediately saved at the moment you change them and will remain even after the app is terminated or your device is restarted.

data.name: Sheet.Settings.Options.Header
data.value: Options

data.name: Sheet.Settings.Option.Whole.Label
data.value: • Use whole numbers?

data.name: Sheet.Settings.Option.Whole.Line1
data.value: Sets the app to use whole numbers or decimals. In case is set for the latter (Off) the app will round the decimals in intervals of 25, 50 and 75 to make it easier for the guests to pay their share.
